speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: ACT II

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: SCENE I. Paris. The KING's palace.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Flourish of cornets. Enter the KING, attended  with divers young Lords taking leave for the Florentine war; BERTRAM, and PAROLLES

speaker: KING
text_entry: Farewell, young lords; these warlike principles

speaker: KING
text_entry: Do not throw from you: and you, my lords, farewell:

speaker: KING
text_entry: Share the advice betwixt you; if both gain, all

speaker: KING
text_entry: The gift doth stretch itself as 'tis received,

speaker: KING
text_entry: And is enough for both.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: 'Tis our hope, sir,

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: After well enter'd soldiers, to return

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: And find your grace in health.

speaker: KING
text_entry: No, no, it cannot be; and yet my heart

speaker: KING
text_entry: Will not confess he owes the malady

speaker: KING
text_entry: That doth my life besiege. Farewell, young lords;

speaker: KING
text_entry: Whether I live or die, be you the sons

speaker: KING
text_entry: Of worthy Frenchmen: let higher Italy,--

speaker: KING
text_entry: Those bated that inherit but the fall

speaker: KING
text_entry: Of the last monarchy,--see that you come

speaker: KING
text_entry: Not to woo honour, but to wed it; when

speaker: KING
text_entry: The bravest questant shrinks, find what you seek,

speaker: KING
text_entry: That fame may cry you loud: I say, farewell.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Health, at your bidding, serve your majesty!

speaker: KING
text_entry: Those girls of Italy, take heed of them:

speaker: KING
text_entry: They say, our French lack language to deny,

speaker: KING
text_entry: If they demand: beware of being captives,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Before you serve.

speaker: Both
text_entry: Our hearts receive your warnings.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Farewell. Come hither to me.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Exit, attended

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: O, my sweet lord, that you will stay behind us!

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: 'Tis not his fault, the spark.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: O, 'tis brave wars!

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Most admirable: I have seen those wars.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: I am commanded here, and kept a coil with

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: 'Too young' and 'the next year' and ''tis too early.'

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: An thy mind stand to't, boy, steal away bravely.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: I shall stay here the forehorse to a smock,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Creaking my shoes on the plain masonry,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Till honour be bought up and no sword worn

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: But one to dance with! By heaven, I'll steal away.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: There's honour in the theft.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Commit it, count.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: I am your accessary; and so, farewell.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: I grow to you, and our parting is a tortured body.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Farewell, captain.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Sweet Monsieur Parolles!

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Noble heroes, my sword and yours are kin. Good

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: sparks and lustrous, a word, good metals: you shall

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: find in the regiment of the Spinii one Captain

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Spurio, with his cicatrice, an emblem of war, here

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: on his sinister cheek; it was this very sword

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: entrenched it: say to him, I live; and observe his

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: reports for me.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: We shall, noble captain.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Exeunt Lords

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Mars dote on you for his novices! what will ye do?

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Stay: the king.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Re-enter KING. BERTRAM and PAROLLES retire

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: [To BERTRAM]  Use a more spacious ceremony to the

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: noble lords; you have restrained yourself within the

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: list of too cold an adieu: be more expressive to

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: them: for they wear themselves in the cap of the

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: time, there do muster true gait, eat, speak, and

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: move under the influence of the most received star;

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: and though the devil lead the measure, such are to

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: be followed: after them, and take a more dilated farewell.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: And I will do so.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Worthy fellows; and like to prove most sinewy sword-men.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Exeunt BERTRAM and PAROLLES

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Enter LAFEU

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: [Kneeling]  Pardon, my lord, for me and for my tidings.

speaker: KING
text_entry: I'll fee thee to stand up.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Then here's a man stands, that has brought his pardon.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: I would you had kneel'd, my lord, to ask me mercy,

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: And that at my bidding you could so stand up.

speaker: KING
text_entry: I would I had; so I had broke thy pate,

speaker: KING
text_entry: And ask'd thee mercy for't.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Good faith, across: but, my good lord 'tis thus;

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Will you be cured of your infirmity?

speaker: KING
text_entry: No.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: O, will you eat no grapes, my royal fox?

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Yes, but you will my noble grapes, an if

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: My royal fox could reach them: I have seen a medicine

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: That's able to breathe life into a stone,

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Quicken a rock, and make you dance canary

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: With spritely fire and motion; whose simple touch,

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Is powerful to araise King Pepin, nay,

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: To give great Charlemain a pen in's hand,

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: And write to her a love-line.

speaker: KING
text_entry: What 'her' is this?

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Why, Doctor She: my lord, there's one arrived,

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: If you will see her: now, by my faith and honour,

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: If seriously I may convey my thoughts

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: In this my light deliverance, I have spoke

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: With one that, in her sex, her years, profession,

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Wisdom and constancy, hath amazed me more

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Than I dare blame my weakness: will you see her

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: For that is her demand, and know her business?

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: That done, laugh well at me.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Now, good Lafeu,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Bring in the admiration; that we with thee

speaker: KING
text_entry: May spend our wonder too, or take off thine

speaker: KING
text_entry: By wondering how thou took'st it.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Nay, I'll fit you,

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: And not be all day neither.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Exit

speaker: KING
text_entry: Thus he his special nothing ever prologues.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Re-enter LAFEU, with HELENA

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Nay, come your ways.

speaker: KING
text_entry: This haste hath wings indeed.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Nay, come your ways:

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: This is his majesty; say your mind to him:

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: A traitor you do look like; but such traitors

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: His majesty seldom fears: I am Cressid's uncle,

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: That dare leave two together; fare you well.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Exit

speaker: KING
text_entry: Now, fair one, does your business follow us?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Ay, my good lord.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Gerard de Narbon was my father;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: In what he did profess, well found.

speaker: KING
text_entry: I knew him.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: The rather will I spare my praises towards him:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Knowing him is enough. On's bed of death

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Many receipts he gave me: chiefly one.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Which, as the dearest issue of his practise,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: And of his old experience the oily darling,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: He bade me store up, as a triple eye,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Safer than mine own two, more dear; I have so;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: And hearing your high majesty is touch'd

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: With that malignant cause wherein the honour

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Of my dear father's gift stands chief in power,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I come to tender it and my appliance

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: With all bound humbleness.

speaker: KING
text_entry: We thank you, maiden;

speaker: KING
text_entry: But may not be so credulous of cure,

speaker: KING
text_entry: When our most learned doctors leave us and

speaker: KING
text_entry: The congregated college have concluded

speaker: KING
text_entry: That labouring art can never ransom nature

speaker: KING
text_entry: From her inaidible estate; I say we must not

speaker: KING
text_entry: So stain our judgment, or corrupt our hope,

speaker: KING
text_entry: To prostitute our past-cure malady

speaker: KING
text_entry: To empirics, or to dissever so

speaker: KING
text_entry: Our great self and our credit, to esteem

speaker: KING
text_entry: A senseless help when help past sense we deem.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: My duty then shall pay me for my pains:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I will no more enforce mine office on you.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Humbly entreating from your royal thoughts

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: A modest one, to bear me back again.

speaker: KING
text_entry: I cannot give thee less, to be call'd grateful:

speaker: KING
text_entry: Thou thought'st to help me; and such thanks I give

speaker: KING
text_entry: As one near death to those that wish him live:

speaker: KING
text_entry: But what at full I know, thou know'st no part,

speaker: KING
text_entry: I knowing all my peril, thou no art.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: What I can do can do no hurt to try,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Since you set up your rest 'gainst remedy.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: He that of greatest works is finisher

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Oft does them by the weakest minister:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: So holy writ in babes hath judgment shown,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: When judges have been babes; great floods have flown

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: From simple sources, and great seas have dried

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: When miracles have by the greatest been denied.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Oft expectation fails and most oft there

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Where most it promises, and oft it hits

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Where hope is coldest and despair most fits.

speaker: KING
text_entry: I must not hear thee; fare thee well, kind maid;

speaker: KING
text_entry: Thy pains not used must by thyself be paid:

speaker: KING
text_entry: Proffers not took reap thanks for their reward.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Inspired merit so by breath is barr'd:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: It is not so with Him that all things knows

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: As 'tis with us that square our guess by shows;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: But most it is presumption in us when

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: The help of heaven we count the act of men.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Dear sir, to my endeavours give consent;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Of heaven, not me, make an experiment.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I am not an impostor that proclaim

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Myself against the level of mine aim;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: But know I think and think I know most sure

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: My art is not past power nor you past cure.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Are thou so confident? within what space

speaker: KING
text_entry: Hopest thou my cure?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: The great'st grace lending grace

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Ere twice the horses of the sun shall bring

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Their fiery torcher his diurnal ring,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Ere twice in murk and occidental damp

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Moist Hesperus hath quench'd his sleepy lamp,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Or four and twenty times the pilot's glass

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Hath told the thievish minutes how they pass,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: What is infirm from your sound parts shall fly,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Health shall live free and sickness freely die.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Upon thy certainty and confidence

speaker: KING
text_entry: What darest thou venture?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Tax of impudence,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: A strumpet's boldness, a divulged shame

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Traduced by odious ballads: my maiden's name

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Sear'd otherwise; nay, worse--if worse--extended

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: With vilest torture let my life be ended.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Methinks in thee some blessed spirit doth speak

speaker: KING
text_entry: His powerful sound within an organ weak:

speaker: KING
text_entry: And what impossibility would slay

speaker: KING
text_entry: In common sense, sense saves another way.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Thy life is dear; for all that life can rate

speaker: KING
text_entry: Worth name of life in thee hath estimate,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Youth, beauty, wisdom, courage, all

speaker: KING
text_entry: That happiness and prime can happy call:

speaker: KING
text_entry: Thou this to hazard needs must intimate

speaker: KING
text_entry: Skill infinite or monstrous desperate.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Sweet practiser, thy physic I will try,

speaker: KING
text_entry: That ministers thine own death if I die.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: If I break time, or flinch in property

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Of what I spoke, unpitied let me die,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: And well deserved: not helping, death's my fee;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: But, if I help, what do you promise me?

speaker: KING
text_entry: Make thy demand.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: But will you make it even?

speaker: KING
text_entry: Ay, by my sceptre and my hopes of heaven.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Then shalt thou give me with thy kingly hand

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: What husband in thy power I will command:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Exempted be from me the arrogance

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: To choose from forth the royal blood of France,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: My low and humble name to propagate

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: With any branch or image of thy state;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: But such a one, thy vassal, whom I know

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Is free for me to ask, thee to bestow.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Here is my hand; the premises observed,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Thy will by my performance shall be served:

speaker: KING
text_entry: So make the choice of thy own time, for I,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Thy resolved patient, on thee still rely.

speaker: KING
text_entry: More should I question thee, and more I must,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Though more to know could not be more to trust,

speaker: KING
text_entry: From whence thou camest, how tended on: but rest

speaker: KING
text_entry: Unquestion'd welcome and undoubted blest.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Give me some help here, ho! If thou proceed

speaker: KING
text_entry: As high as word, my deed shall match thy meed.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Flourish. Exeunt
